article: My name is Scott and I am 36-years old. I have spent most of my adult life doing an _ job, so I had a very cynical view of life and the world around me. I saw no point in trying to _ my life or the lives of the people around me. Two years ago my wife _ me to return to school and work toward a career where I would find satisfaction. So I entered Long Beach City College to pursue a _ in history. Last term I took a political science class. The _ Dr. Rock had such a great effect on me. He _ in the Air Force, worked in the U.S. nuclear program and served in the White House. When I asked another instructor _ someone who was so overqualified worked at a small community college, she _ told me because he wanted to. This _ me, so I asked Dr. Rock himself why he did not pursue a better role in his career. What he told me has changed my _ forever. He told me that by working at the college he would be able to _ the kinds of students he believed would make a _ in the world. He said that _ the right motivation and support, the students he taught could become the future leaders of our country. He said that he preferred the inner city _ because the students there showed the _ promise and cared deeply for their education. Dr. Rock paid attention to the needs of the community. He taught me how to care and _ us to take part in our community in any way we _ . I thought that I was the _ one that was affected by his lessons, but at the end of the term I found that the entire class had felt the same _ that came over me. Dr. Rock taught us how to _ our country, our community and ourselves.
